author: Stephen Wilmot
title: For $9 Billion, Chinese Automotive Tycoon Gets Tangle of Relationships - WSJ
text:
Chinese billionaire Li Shufu may find it easier to talk about cooperation in the car industry than to achieve it.
The owner of automotive holding group Zhejiang Geely announced the acquisition of a 9.7% stake in Mercedes-Benz maker Daimler AG late on Friday. Now worth roughly $8.9 billion, the shares were bought using offshore commercial debt, with the asset itself posted as collateral, according to a person familiar with its structure.
...
